Artificial salt water and medium MGM:
Artificial salt water solutions are designed to mimic the natural concentrated brines where haloarchaea are found. The formulation used by M. Dyall-Smith (described in the online handbook, the Halohandbook, http://www.haloarchaea.com/resources/halohandbook/) is based on that described by Rodriguez-Valera et al. (Rodriguez-Valera et al. 1980; Torreblanca et al. 1986).
Per liter, it contains:  
4 M NaCl
150 mM MgCl2
150 mM MgSO4
90 mM KCl
3.5 mM CaCl2
adjusted to pH 7.5 using ca. 2 mL 1 M Tris-HCl (pH 7.5). At 30% w/v, the total salts are present in a much higher concentration than in seawater, but in approximately the same proportions. Adjustments of Mg2+, pH, or other conditions may be necessary for specific haloarchaeal groups. Modified growth medium (MGM) contains 5 g peptone and 1 g yeast extract per liter of salt water. The salt concentration is varied according to the host strain, and is detailed in the Halohandbook.
